description: Unicursal (i.e. possessing an Eulerian path) planar rooted maps with n edges.
comments: Unicursal (in a broad sense) means that no more than two vertices are of odd valency (that is maps possessing an Eulerian path or cycle).
links: V. A. Liskovets and T. R. S. Walsh, Enumeration of Eulerian and unicursal planar maps, Discr. Math., 282 (2004), 209-221.
mathematica: a[n_] := 2^(n-1)*(3*Binomial[2*n, n]/((n+1)*(n+2))+Binomial[2*n-1, n]); a[0]=1; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 20}] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Dec 11 2014 *)
author: _Valery A. Liskovets_
extensions: More terms from _Valery A. Liskovets_, Apr 07 2002
